title: Over 1,000 anti-Trump Labor Day protests held across the US
shortDescription: Labor unions and community activists organized widespread protests on Labor Day as part of demonstrations against the Trump administration.

title: Congress faces potential government shutdown. Here's what to know.
shortDescription: A partial government shutdown looms Oct. 1 unless Congress can overcome partisan bickering and a loss of trillions in tariffs to keep the lights on.

title: Judge blocks Trump deployment of National Guard in California
shortDescription: A federal judge blocked President Donald Trump's deployment of the National Guard in California, citing the 'ongoing risk' of violating federal law.

title: Congress is back, shutdown looms
shortDescription: Congress faces a possible government shutdown as Democrats push back on GOP budget cuts and demands.

title: Where’s Barron Trump? NYU classes start for very private public figure
shortDescription: The president and Melania, Donald Trump Jr., Ivanka, Eric, Tiffany, Vanessa, Kai, and Donald Trump III have made headlines. But where's Barron?

title: Daily Briefing: Congress' summer break is over
shortDescription: Lawmakers face a tight deadline to fund the government. Here is the news to know on Tuesday.

title: China's Xi convenes 'Axis of Upheaval' in Beijing, sidelining Trump
shortDescription: China's President Xi Jinping convened his Russian and North Korean counterparts together for the first time on Tuesday.

title: Epstein files and a possible shutdown: The heat is on in Congress
shortDescription: As lawmakers return from August recess, tensions loom over the federal budget, the Epstein files and redistricting.

title: Longtime Rep. Jerry Nadler won't seek reelection
shortDescription: U.S. Rep. Jerry Nadler, D-N.Y., announces he won't seek reelection in 2026.

title: 'Generational change:' Longtime Democratic Rep. Jerry Nadler won't seek reelection
shortDescription: Jerry Nadler, a more than 30-year veteran of Congress, announced he will not run for reelection.

title: Trump to award Rudy Giuliani with Presidential Medal of Freedom
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said he will award former New York Mayor Rudy Giuliani with the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation's highest civilian honor.

title: Trump demands drugmakers 'justify their success' with COVID vaccines
shortDescription: President Trump called on drug companies to "justify their success" in combating the COVID virus, demanding the immediate release of data.

title: Trump wants to mandate voter IDs. Can he do that?
shortDescription: Court rulings that presidents don't have the power to set election rules aren't stopping President Trump from pushing for voter ID requirements.

title: What to know about Labor Day protests against Trump and billionaires
shortDescription: Protesters hit the streets for Labor Day demonstrations against President Donald Trump and his billionaire allies.

title: What is Trump’s approval rating? August poll shows historic comparison
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has been in office for more than 7 months, and his approval rating is stable, though remains historically low.

title: Save thousands on a car by stacking Trump's tax credits with Biden's
shortDescription: Presidents Donald Trump and Joe Biden created car-buying incentives. Here's how to take advantage of both before Biden's expires in September.

title: ICE agents burning out amid Trump's aggressive enforcement
shortDescription: As ICE launches a recruitment effort to hire 10,000 more officers, existing staff struggle with long hours, growing public outrage.

title: Trump says he will sign executive order requiring voter ID
shortDescription: Trump has falsely claimed that his 2020 loss to Democratic President Joe Biden was the result of widespread fraud.

title: Judge blocks Trump from deporting unaccompanied Guatemalan children
shortDescription: The lawsuit argued that the plan to expel the children violates protections under the Trafficking Victims Protection Reauthorization Act.

title: Chicago mayor pushes back on Trump's troop plan
shortDescription: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson launched Protecting Chicago Initiative to fight back against President Trump's possible federal troop deployment.
